benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Add tags to payment

covered: POST - Valid Payload: Successful creation with required and optional headers (TC01, TC02, TC03) and correct 201 with JSON array of Tag objects.
POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, missing required header, invalid UUID formats, unexpected fields, null elements (TC07, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC17).
POST - Non-Existing Resource: 404 when payment not found or DB empty (TC05, TC18).
POST - Large Payloads/Boundary: Very large arrays and peak-load performance (TC12, TC14).
POST - Validation: Path UUID format validation and body UUID validation (TC06, TC09).
Duplicate handling/idempotency-like behavior: Duplicate tag UUIDs and pre-existing tags do not create duplicates (TC11, TC19).
Concurrency: Concurrent POST requests maintain consistency without duplicates (TC20).
Server/Dependency errors: Service dependency unavailable returns 503 (TC13).
Security/Authorization: Unauthorized user returns 401/403, malicious payload rejected (TC15, TC16).
gaps: POST - Server Error Handling: No explicit simulation/assertion of 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB failure).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios validating 429 or behavior under enforced rate limits during bursts.
Missing Request Body: No test for completely missing body resulting in 400.
Unsupported Media Type: No test for incorrect Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) expecting 415.
Accept/Content Negotiation: No test for unacceptable Accept header (e.g., Accept: text/xml) expecting 406 if enforced.
Authorization Token Handling: No scenario for missing/expired auth token leading to 401 (background assumes valid token).
Exceeding Limits: No test for array size exceeding maximum allowed returning appropriate 400/413.
Unknown Tag Definition IDs: No test where tag UUIDs are well-formed but do not correspond to existing tag definitions (expected 400/404 per API rules).
Header Validation: No tests for overlong/invalid X-Killbill-Reason/Comment values if server enforces length/charset constraints.
recommendations: Add a scenario to simulate internal server failure (e.g., DB outage) and assert 500 with error payload.
Introduce rate limiting tests: rapid-fire POSTs triggering 429 and proper Retry-After handling.
Add a test for missing request body to assert 400 with clear validation error.
Add a test with Content-Type: text/plain (or missing Content-Type) to assert 415 Unsupported Media Type.
Add a test with Accept: text/xml (or unsupported) to assert 406 Not Acceptable if applicable.
Create a scenario for missing/expired auth token to assert 401 with correct WWW-Authenticate details.
Add boundary breach test: payload with more than the maximum allowed tag UUIDs to assert 400/413.
Add a scenario for non-existent tag definition UUIDs (valid format, not found) to assert correct error (400 or 404) based on API contract.
Include negative header validation tests for X-Killbill-Reason/Comment length/charset if validated by the service.
